info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 04 at 10:32PM CDT until August 05 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN MONTGOMERY...EAST CENTRAL CALLAWAY...OSAGE AND NORTHWESTERN GASCONADE COUNTIES... At 1032 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Mineola to near Big Spring to near Hermann to near Chamois to near Rich Fountain, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Montgomery City, Hermann, Linn, New Florence, Chamois, Westphalia, Rich Fountain, Big Spring, Mineola, Mount Sterling, Gasconade, Rhineland, Morrison, McKittrick, Portland, Danville, Americus, Frankenstein, Bay, and Loose Creek. This also includes Deutschheim Historic Site and Graham Cave State Park. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 170 and 175. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
